case_title: MUHAMMAD BASHIR vs PUNJAB PROVINCE AND 7 OTHERS

issues.description: Whether the plaintiff's suit is maintainable in law?
Whether suit is bad for misjoinder of parties?
Whether suit is bad for misjoinder of causes of action?
Whether suit is not maintainable in the present form?
Whether the plaintiff is entitled to be posted as junior clerk on the basis of his candidature in the list maintained by the defendant?
Whether no list is being maintained for candidate-clerks in the defendant's office since 1964?
What is the effect of non-appearance of the plaintiff in the test interview for the selection of junior clerks?

key_findings: The petitioner was entitled to be appointed as junior clerk based on his inclusion in the list of approved candidates maintained by the Deputy Commissioner.
The Deputy Commissioner acted illegally by ignoring the petitioner during the appointment process on January 13, 1970.
Orders dated June 20, 1970 (Commissioner, Multan Division) and November 23, 1970 (Board of Revenue) upholding the Deputy Commissioner's actions were declared illegal and ineffective.
The petitioner was not required to appear for test and interview as his legal right was established under rule 3.5 of the District Office Manual.

legal_basis.rule_8: West Pakistan Revenue Department District Ministerial Service Rules, 1964
legal_basis.rule_11: West Pakistan Revenue Department District Ministerial Service Rules, 1964

relief_granted.declaratory_decree: Petitioner entitled to appointment as junior clerk on January 13, 1970.
relief_granted.illegal_orders: Orders dated June 20, 1970 and November 23, 1970 declared illegal and ineffective.
relief_granted.appointment_challenge: Petitioner's challenge to appointments of respondents Nos. 2 to 8 and others disallowed.

costs: Parties to bear their own costs.
